page.title: 05Education in the Wolfords
page.content: The County Councils of Warwickshire and Gloucestershire provide free education for all children aged 5-18 & provide grants for further education at Universities and Polytecnics. Since the village schools closed, children from the Wolfords attend either Shipston on Stour or Long Compton School. Todenham Children go to Moreton in Marsh an option open also to Great Wolford. At eleven, Todenham children go to Chipping Campden School and Little Wolford to Shipston. Great Wolford has a choice of either. At 16 it is possible to go to Colleges of Further education at Stratford, Leamington, or Cheltenham. Free transport is provided. Many children are educated privately 70% in Great Wolford, 40% in Little Wolford and 29% in Todenham. The only nursery school education is in private playgroups.
